page.title: 04INTERESTING FEATURES
page.content:
{WOTTON HILL.}THE HILL ABOVE W_U_E, CROWNED WITH A WALLED CLUMP OF FIRS IS A NOTABLE LANDMARK. THE TREES WERE FIRST PLANTED TO COMMEMORATE THE BATTLE OF WATERLOO.{BRACKENBURY {DITCHES.}THIS IS THE SIGHT OF AN IRON AGE CAMP, SITUATED IN AN ELEVATED POSITION IN THE WESTRIDGE WOODS. THE DITCHES ARE NOT EASY TO SEE BECAUSE OF TREE COVER. THE SIGHT HAS A NATURALLY STRONG DEFENSIVE POSITION WITH A WATER SUPPLY JUST BELOW THE HILL AT BOURNSTREAM.{HUGH PERY ALMS_HOUSES} SITUATED IN CHURCH STREET. THESE HAVE A SIX GABLED FRONT WITH A BELL_CUPOLA IN THE CENTRE. THROUGH THE TUDOR DOORWAY IS A QUADRANGLE WITH A TUDOR CHAPEL IN THE CENTRE. THEY WERE FOUNDED BY HUGH PERRY IN 1634.{ (CONT. ON PAGE 5)
{
